rComments: clearly a math genius! extremely straight forward class and laid out syllabus. if you put in the effort it is an easy A. also great person in general very approachable !
Lectures are boring and he teaches proofs during the whole lecture
Weekly quizzes, pretty straight forward. There's a lot of Katznelson haters out there but It's a little unwarranted. He's not the best, but he's not that bad.

The study guides help you study for the exam but the problems are not the same. He may put one version of a question on the study guide and do the opposite version on the exam. The TA's give a good amount of partial credit, but unless you know you failed or aced the exam you don't really know how you are going to do.
Can be confusing, Not very clear, Although homework was not mandatory need to do it for test

Katznelson is a nice person and if you go talk to him during office hours, he clearly demonstrates that he wants you to do well. However, his lectures are very difficult to follow. He teaches almost exclusively in proofs and theorems, with few examples.  I found lecture to be unnecessary, and passed by going to section multiple times per week.

It's true that he takes almost the entirety of lecture to go through proofs and theories. He emphasizes theories quite heavily on exams and if you don't go through the proofs in the book than it's hard to get an A. Practice exams were pretty helpful. However, I got through his class by understanding just the computational portion of linear algebra.

Quizzes were easy, but the midterm and final were substantially more difficult. Lectures were essentially useless, and although the study guides he provided reflected his lectures, it had almost no relation to the actual tests besides the computational aspects. Lives up to his reputation, terrible professor, don't take him unless you have to.

Professor Katzneslon was a good guy. His lectures were intense and you had to be there to understand his expectations on the material. Really, this class could have been so hard and the homework and sample exams were. In the end though the final and midterm were not that bad. Sample final had 15 questions, actual final had 6.

Katznelson is intelligent and knows his math; however, when it comes to explaining, it's a bit difficult to understand him. His lectures are concept-based so he really won't teach you how to compute problems. He won't given you examples unless you ask for them. Recommend to take MSI, LSS, or ACE concurrent with the class if you want to pass.

He is a very quick paced lecturer. For me, this is a good thing, but some students struggled. Take the time to really understand the homeworks and you'll do well on the tests. Office hours are useful for getting questions answered.

I took his class for both 11A11B. He is not actually as bad as everyone says. He is very intelligent. This class is very difficult and the way he explains things is very complicated. But if you actually study for the quizzes by reading the book or study you notes, and do the past midterms and finals then you'll pass the class with at least a B+.
Terrible teacher, didn't learn anything. Lectures were so pointless, nothing like the exams. Go to MSI, forget lecture and i hope this teacher gets fired
Never take this class. The lectures are long. Didn't learn a thing from this professor, learned from my TA and the MSI. Very tough class!

The best math teacher. Imparts perspective of the bigger picture. Each lecture was a masterpiece. Best part of my day was this class. Would take again. Yes, Katznelson is the best math teacher you'll ever have.

Katzelson is a good professor, but he can go off on tangents sometimes or explain things in overcomplicated proofs. However, his tests are very transparent, & he lays out what he wants you to know on them well. Get a previous midterm from an MSI instructor and study it, and GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!! He's extremely helpful, but still a bit intimidating.

I felt like going to his class made me more confused. He really likes to prove everything and explain why calculus proofs are like this. His notes will confuse you and his handwriting is a mess. I went to MSI and I'm pretty sure that's what saved me in this class.

Katznelson is less of a teacher and more of a robot that scribbles out numbers on a piece of paper in front of the class without much thought or explanation. His "explanations" only confuse the students even more than they already are. Calculus isn't an easy course for anyone, but Katznelson succeeded in making it harder than I imagined possible.

With his bad handwriting, you will never understand what he is writing if you stopped listening for a second. Lectures are pretty useless because his examples are too basic, you can just look it up in textbook. If you're planning to take Ams 11, I suggest you not to take his course because he's not a good professor, not even close.
He is passionate about the subject.  I like his style of teaching. Fast pace, but makes his point very clear.  Go through proof and example.
Hah. Katznelson is fierce! He doesn't tolerate any BS! I loved how he answered questions during lecture! Lecture is a bit ehh, but writes out great examples! Study the reviews and you will do fine!

After reading all of the reviews here, I was scared I was going to fail. BUT as long as you do your hw and go over the midterm review (and go to all of the sections) you will do just FINE. Dont listen to the haters cause they eiher didnt attend class or studied. Just do your part and you will be happy with your grade.

I took Lin. Alg. with him last Fall, and I liked him. He doesn't tolerate **** questions and moves at a good pace in lecture. Expects people to have done the reading and really think about the concepts. Always available during office hours, great in person. Exams are fair, if you've done the HW and his review, you will pass this class, no prob.
Worst teacher at UCSC. Teaches by showing us proofs, does no real examples.  Must know how to self teach if taking his course.. Did I really spend $3000 dollars to teach myself out of a book?
worst teacher ever. try to show students how much dumb they are rather then teaching them better. 0 teaching skills. over all quality is poor.

I was worried about taking this class at first, just from what I had heard about having to teach yourself. The truth is, he's really true to the hw he assigns and the midterm reviews. If you did all your hw and know how to do the 6 questions on the review then your set for the class. I suck at math, and this is the first time I've done well.
not very helpful. tells you just to study more if you go ask for help. goes fast through class. use study guides very similar to his tests

BEST teacher I've had at UCSC! He goes over everything in a way that makes a lot of sense to me. He expects you to keep up on reading, but people who dislike math shouldn't be in this class to begin with. Also, I have a big fat crush on him.

WOW, i just got my grade for this class. Personally, i learn by examples. He may be brilliant but doesnt teach this way. hates student questions, very strict. I did not like him at all. lecture was boring, book not helpful. be prepared to study your butt off. 11a isn't too bad once u go to 11b. ask an econ major for the tests. i barely got a C.

You either love Katz or ABSOLUTELY hate him. Personally, I think he's among the best professors at UCSC, but that's just me. Must pass final exam to pass class. P.S. Final exam is worth 50% of your overall grade. :)

Rather incomprehensible. He teaches mostly theory and proofs, yet he teaches those almost solely in the form of linear combinations, which is very unintuitive in my opinion. Even when I knew the material, I could barely keep up in class. While he knows his stuff, he can only explain things one way.
He teaches mostly theory and proofs.  He goes really fast also.
Great, intimidating at first but I got used to him. Tests were fair and homework was very manageable. I learned a lot and would recommend this prof to anyone.
He's hard but he's really really good. Expect to work but if you do you'll learn a ton.  He's also pretty funny.
Katznelson is a great professor, he is mean but definitely no BS. His tests are not hard if you study his sample tests.ps. do the hw.

Katz knows his stuff, but he assumes 100% mastery of EVERYTHING prior to his class. This is, of course, impossible. Read the book 3 times, go to section twice, and get a tutor. Katz doesn't much give a damn, he just gets his paycheck. Friends of mine did great on every test and homework, and still barely scraped by. Good luck.

Loved this Teacher! His lectures were clear and understandable, all of the course material was easy to grasp with a little bit of work. Most people who are giving him a bad rating probably didn't show up to class. about half the class only showed up for midterms and the final.  Great professor with a great sense of humor.

Katznelson's tests are based on the fact that will memorize the trick to do particular proofs that you may have seen once in his class (and if he proves it, you probaly can't understand what he is trying to say)

This teacher is awesome. I found him very easy because I actually went to every class. All these people saying he is hard are the 80% of class who don't even show up. I feel bad his rating is so low. I took 11A and 11B with him both and they both were easy with him. Very helpful teacher who cares about his students.
Worst math class I took, he confuses concepts. worst thing is attendance is mandatory. I rather take the math 11 or 19 series
This is a self taught class. Lectures are useless. You are better off using your class time to study. Go to MSI/Section for help from TA's. Quizzes and Tests are decent.

The class is somewhat difficult and when he explains stuff, he explains how to get to the formula, doesn't really apply it, but if you go to his office hours or section and actually study, you'll be fine. All and all I liked the class, he really preps you

The course is pretty hard, if you're not good at math I highly suggest going to section/MSI. His overall attitude is a little abusive but he is a fair grader and isn't completely cruel. Liked the class though.

He's hard, but fair. Class was pretty intense but I would be lying if I said I didn't learn a ton. Virtually everything he teaches is applied in the later upper division courses. I'm thankful I worked hard in his classes because it paid off tremendously in the long run.
Quite a useless teacher. Doesn't teach very well, so he expects you to learn from the homework which he does not give the solutions for...

self-taught class. just do the homework, study all his supplement reviews and you'll do well. 8 quizzes, drops 3. 1 midterm and 1 final. he doesn't tell you what is on the midterm/final and is pretty useless at sharing crucial information. SIGN UP FOR TUTORING IF YOU NEED HELP. IT IS VERY USEFUL!!

Don't listen to the bad reviews. He may not be the sweetest person on the planet, but he is a good teacher and will help you if you ask for it. High school calculus recommended before taking this course.

I got a C in 11A, than A+ in 11B. Hard class, but if you put in the time you'll do great(Which I didn't do during 11A) Material is hard, but whatever is on your quizzes and tests comes directly from class, homework or the problem sets! MAKE SURE TO STUDY THE PROBLEM SETS!! I turned from hating 11A to 11B being my favorite class! "Do work son!" LOL

He is the worst math teacher I have ever had. He teaches proofs, and then doesnt explain how to actually apply the proofs. He is harsh, mean, and doesn't care about his students at all. I got an A+ in his class because of MSI.

Hard to approach in person. Not friendly. Does know his material though. I'm not a fan of the requirements for the business major but I have to say that I began disliking math after taking 2 math courses with him. It was his 2 specific math classes that lowered my cum. GPA. If you're a fast learner than he might help you but if not, then avoid him.

Going to lecture is so useless. All he tries to teach you is conceptual material without showing you how to solve problems. He's like a math textbook: you can read the material all you want but if you dont do the problems, do not expect to understand it ever...
His class isn't as bad as other reviews make it seem. You have to study and go to class. His quizzes are easy and his tests are somewhat difficult. Overall he's a good teacher.
Do not take this class if you don't plan on devoting a great deal of your time to it. I spent the recommended amount of time, went to MSI and section, and still did very poorly.

Surprisingly, I enjoyed this class.  You MUST read ahead if you want to understand the lecture.  He offers great supplementary material on his website if you get lost or have stupid questions he wont answer in class.  He's a bit rough around the edges, but overall, a very knowledgeable instructor.
THIS FOOL WAS NOT HELPFUL AT ALL HE IS SUPER BORING. I spent a ton of time on this class. He is a terrible guy .And crazy eyebrows

I would have appreciated this class if I was a Math major or someone who wants to know how theorems are derived. Katznelson isn't the clearest nor affable professor out there, but his tests are incredibly fair and reasonable. I failed the first midterm, but aced the second one and ended up getting a B as my final grade. Section helps, so go.

Overall, he is a very good professor with a great sense of humor, but the main problem other students seem to have is that he spends a most of the lecture focusing on theory and how formulas are derived rather than actual applications, but that's what the homework, sections, and MSI are for. Avoid missing classes, a lot of material is covered.

Katz is a good guy and great teacher. He's a math person's teacher. This class level definitely weeds out the non math people. I'm not great at math and struggle but that's not his fault. He's very helpful. If you don't work hard, go to class, do lots of problems and homework you will find this class extremely hard. Go to section!

He definitely knows what he is doing, but assumes it will be just as clear to everyone else. Sometimes the way he answers questions in class feels like he is attacking you, but go to section, read the book, and you'll be fine.

He is mean, thinks everything is simple. Spends way to much on how formulas are derived rather than applying. His test have 3 to 4 questions....1 wrong and your at a c or d. Ask trick questions and then shuts down his students. WORST TEACHER IVE HAD

The class is easy for serious students. His attitude may be abrasive but I'd rather have someone tell me I'm wrong than to try and sugar coat it for me. Do the HW, the reviews, and with a bit of practice it's an easy A. If you have trouble in the class you haven't put the work in. Quit blaming the professor, it's pretty pathetic.
i think katznelson is the best math teacher i have had so far..pretty intimidating but after two quarters he grows on you. tests are just like the reviews so definetly study those

I took this class being a 3.5 average student. After much hard work I got a D in the class. I would suggest to anyone interested in taking this class that you take it else where such as at Foothill Community college or Cabrillo Community college in Aptos. I took it at Foothill and got an A. This class will ruin your GPA so take it somewhere else!!
Good teacher. He knows his stuff. Do the homework, go to MSI, go to class!! Homework counts a lot, so do well on that and it'll help your test scores if you're in the B average.
The class isn't that bad, all you have to do to do well in the class is to do the homework, go to test reviews, and do the review questions. Lectures didn't help me for 11A but it did for 11B.
Umm.. this guy just isn't cut out for teaching. He make things look more difficult than they seem
This guy is not helpful at all. Read the book and you will do fine. He thinks he is funny but he is really not

I found Katznelson to be rather unapproachable at first, but after visiting his office hours I realized he is incredibly helpful to serious students. He just doesn't waste his time with thoughtless questions. And why should he? It's an upper-division math class. I also enjoyed his lectures. They really clarified the information in the book.

A lot of people changed majors after taking 11A.  I got A's in both A and B and thought they were pretty easy.  Though I kind of liked him, Katznelson is worthless and unapproachable.  Go to MSI and/or section and do the homework and it's easy.  The class actually made me like Calculus, though no thanks to Katz.
Klutznelson always waste time asking questions instead of explaining stuff. Go to Section and MSI and you will be fine
Got an A :). Material was easy.  But don't bother asking him for help at office hours he is very smug. Also class don't help at all just read the book and if you dont get it ask for help from TA
Class is easy if you go to section and MSI. Teacher is useless and not useful.
class and material easy, teacher jackass

he has a strange sense of humor, but a good professor nonetheless. i didn't think the class was that hard, but the final killed it for me. i got A's on all my exams and homework, except the final and ended up with a B in the class. :(

A tough professor who teaches a difficult subject. Material is hard but he wants people to have a greater understanding of mathematics. I have to note that nearly all the recent 1,1,1,1 reviews are from a single class that he complained to my class about. Winter 08 11A did poorly and seem bitter. Spring 08 had same tests but much higher grades.
by far the worst professor i've had
This guy thinks he is a freak en comedian and waste lots of time
AVOID AVOID AVOID! if you get him go get additional help from TA. He jokes around too much and ask students to answer questions instead of teach
GO to MSI and you will be fine this guy is a joke
As long as you pay attention and do at least most of the work his classes are great.  He really focuses on getting students to understand the math, not just on how to do the problem sets.

Lectures more conceptual focusing on definitionstheorems and sometimes their proofs. Gives examples, but not often. Homework assigned, not gradedcollected; up to you to understand the material. In-class quizzes covered basic conceptshw-like material. Midterm and Final covered more in-depth concepts covered in lecture so attending is a good idea.

The quizzes weren't difficult at all as long as you completed reading and homework on a weekly basis.  The final and midterm can either make or break your grade.  Working on past finals and midterms were more helpful than attending lectures.  Sections were helpful too.

Hardest class of my life, but the material itself is not that difficult. I took vector calculus and got a B+, but got a C in this class (thank god). The teacher is essentially useless. His lectures talk about concepts and rarely explains them. He teaches through proofs and often does not go over how to do problems. The final was 50% of grade :( :(

This is a class you need to pay attention in, and although homework isn't collected or graded, it's necessary to do it in order to pass the class. Quizzestests are just like the homework! Super helpful in office hours and go to section!

If you have this teacher, for god's sake go to section, read the book, and make sure the class is easy for you. Get whatever help you can because he won't be able to help you. I get math, I'm a math major, and I can assure you he made this the hardest class I'm taking. Worst math teacher I ever had.
condescending. His lectures make the material seem harder than it really is

It is very easy to succeed in this class. All you need to do is work on the review questions and you will succeed. Don't bother going to lecture (go only on the day you have quizzes), instead go to section or MSI. The material isn't hard, but Katznelson makes it seem more complicated than it has to be.

Bottom line, this class is very easy to pass. It's not really hard to get a B or A. Don't go to lecture as you will get extremely confused b/c he teaches through proofs and his "examples" are bad. Easiest way to get a good grade is to attend MSI/Section.

Best teacher. Out of all the classes I took at UCSC, Math 100 was the most bang for the buck. And it was all because of this guy. Will take number theory with him next winter, even if I have to sit in for no credit. The best.

Yonaton is a great man. He is tough on his students and requires them to actually put in the time to receive satisfactory results and grasp material. He can give some tricky quizes but overall I give him respect.

Teacher taught exclusively through proofs. I can count examples on one hand. Everything I learned for class I learned through TA's or Youtube. The material is not hard, but he is confusing. When he asks a question to the class and a student gets it wrong he make it sound like they're an idiot, he then gets upset. Smart but, he just cant teach.

Honestly pretty terrible. Had him for Ams 10 and 20 and the lectures are useless and because of that had to teach myself everything. Only good thing is that if you know the review sheets you will be good for the midterms and finals (I got As for both classes) but still extremely frustrating.

I KID YOU NOT...THE ***WORST*** TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE ACADEMIC CAREER. THE WHOLE CLASS IS STRUCTURED OUT OF ONLY 100 POINTS, HE TEACHES STRICTLY IN PROOFS AND IS EXTREMELY UNAPPROACHABLE. SHOOTS QUESTIONS DOWN LIKE I'VE NEVER SEEN BEFORE. BAFFLED HE IS TEACHING AT THE UNIVERSITY LEVEL. ABSOLUTELY AWFUL IN MORE WAYS THAN I CAN EXPLAIN

Very easy midterm (just make sure you know integration), very difficult final. In lecture he wastes too much time on theory and doesn't do enough examples. But he did a better job teaching this then AMS 10 overall.

Would definitely take any class from this man, particularly because his midterm/final reviews are actually like his tests and he has optional hw that if you choose to do will actually be extremely helpful. Tells you exactly what will be on quizzes.Seems mean, but actually super nice. Really knows his stuff.
Despite what everyone says, I think he was actually a great teacher. He does sometimes go into a long proof that isn't at all necessary but that is when you can play flappy birds.

He is a very brilliant man. One of the best professors I have had at UCSC. If you just talk to him about the material, you can tell that he really knows his stuff. May be a bit intimidating to approach, but he is actually pretty friendy.

very interesting. expects you to have learned some math before showing up (reasonable). can seem unapproachable or terse, but is actually very nice and extremely helpful. funny and interesting in class. I found the class easy, though many others did not. you get to drop like half of your quizzes, so easy A in my book.

The class itself is hard and his lectures are hard to understand but i feel like i learned a lot form his class through studying past midterms and exams. His Final is basically the same as his practice exams. You do have to work for the grade but its not a hard class to pass. I feel like what he teaches really prepares you for upper div econ class.
pretentious, but not a bad instructor overall

Going to his class is utterly useless. He cannot teach his way out of a box. You cant really ever understand what the hell the guy is doing up there, and he definitely doesnt take time to explain it. Doesnt provide examples, and it seems like he intentionally tries to trick you on quizes and midterms. Youre pretty much on your own in the  class.

Overall, definitely not my favorite professor at UCSC. Katznelson is extremely intelligent, but also very arrogant. He "welcomes" students to ask questions during lecture, but makes people feel stupid when they do. His exams are tough, but are usually curved. Go to MSI and section and you'll be fine.

Tough cookie!  Get ready for time commitment.  Its a fairly tough class, but he knows what he's doing.  This is a class that weeds people out.  If you take his class and pass, you're going to be READY for 100a.  He's really funny in a cynical kind of way.  go to lecture and attend MSI.  All in all not to bad, i got a C in 11a then got an A in 11b.
He does not answer questions, in lecture or during office hours and makes fun of students who do. He does not facilitate an environment conducive to learning.

Without a doubt, the worse professor at UCSC. Has absolutely no people skills. I'll admit he is a very intelligent guy but when it comes to teaching, not something he does well. He is very belittling to student's questions. If at all possible, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!

Have had Katz for ams 11A and B.  During the first half of 11a I despised the guy, but have grown to really like .  Just don't ask Qs in lecture, he'll just get pissy.  Exams are more often than not strictly application problems.  GO TO MSI and office hours(better to be embarrassed 1 on 1 rather than in front of the whole lecture hall w/ him)
Very fair class. Quizzes come right from the (non-mandatory) homework, tests are identical to homework and practice exams. Do the work expected and you should have no trouble passing.

Yorik is not the most interesting teacher unless you read the book first. He expects that you have read before class, which makes his teaching not so much teaching but more like reinforcing. Luckily, the tests are easy and the book is fabulous.
Great Teacher, Really hard class expect to put a lot of hours in, though you will gain a lot by the time the quarter is up.

He grades hard but he's an extremely well-organized teacher. He use class-time very well and expects you to read before lectures. If you want to do well in his classes in general, prepare to spend 15+ hrs per week. P.S. he gives out review worksheets before exams. You should definitely look at those! Overall, he's a VERY GOOD teacher!
Katz is great. Extremely clear on lectures, notes will help ALOT. Attend class or you are screwed. Very witty too. The tests are not that hard if you attend class and do the review.
Be ready to work 15+ hours if you want to do well. This class had a high failure rate despite him giving us all the answers to the final. 3 papers, hw and a final. All difficult.

The most condescending and arrogant man I have ever met. Have questions.. seek the TA's advise because this man will tell you to read the book and wll answer all of your questions with questions. The book is more usefull than he is. I found many of the lectures useless as well.

Class was very tough and confusing at the beginning but let up a little toward the end since it was my first upper division math class. Grades very hard on the 3 essays now required in the class. It is very helpful to go to TA office hours because they go over class material and essays way MORE in detail than the teacher. Keep up on the notes.

Katznelson is a great teacher who really knew his material well and conveyed it in a very clear way during lectures. His tests were fair and were a lot like his review sheets. If you don't go to class then you will not do well but if you do your homework and pay attention, you should do well in the class.

I had a class with this professor before, and my experience is pretty much the same.~The class is hard, namely the material during the second half and last part of class. It was difficult reading his handwriting, but that was fine with me since I relied mostly on the textbook. Highly recommend going to MSI for homework help, test prep., etc.

My friends told me about how he was a pretty tough professor for AMS11, but I took AMS5 with him during last summer. He taught very well, and he was very informative. His lectures were helpful and he gave good examples. His quizzes were very similar to the homework, so as long as you do the homework, you'll do great!

Everybody who's hating on him must not been studying the materials. His lectures are clear, entertaining(at least to me), and his answers to students' questions are hilarious. Do his review questions, go to MSI, attend lectures, spend time on practicing problems, will earn a fine grade in his class. This guy is legit!
katznelson class is very useful for econ100a. he can be confusing during lectures but if you understand the homework and study his practice exams then you will do fine on midterms and finals.

Katznelson is a great teacher. If you do your homework and don't want your time to be wasted, then you'll love him too. He grades fairly, formats test questions in the same way as homework questions. If your struggling, read ahead. If you don't come to class and expect topics to be clarified 20000 times, you won't like him. Very simple.

Yes, you have to put in effort, and no, this class is by no means an easy A, but come on - you're at a UC. Granted, it's UCSC, but it's still a UC. So don't be a baby. If you actually dedicate a reasonable amount of time and effort, you can really get a lot from his class and realize that, amongst a sea of moronic UCSC professors, he is a genius.

Seriously don't listen to the bad reviews. Yes, he is a little snotty, and yes he goes through the material fast. But there is no one fairer about what comes on the test and partial credit (he'll give you credit for WRITING OUT the steps you should take on a problem). Go to section, DON'T fall behind. He's a good guy; a good professor.
Did not learn one thing
Literally the worst professor ever. I pay for a UC-quality education and this "Professor" clearly fails to provide a positive learning experience.

Teaches almost exclusively through proofs. If you have trouble learning from proofs (like I do) you should probably avoid his class. Fortunately he grades pretty easily so his class is passable even if you can't follow any of the proofs.

I didn't go to class much he uses a lot of math notation that I'm not comfortable with but the material is easy, he just over complicates things. Thing is he thinks cmps or cmpe majors needs to fully know theses kinds of things, maybe we do but I'm doubting we will.

Basically if you follow along, practice, practice on your own math problems before and after lecture, its easy to do good. Is like working out.you do 25-30 mins of practice problems you're set. He's actually very approachable during office hours. As a student, you just get out what you put in. So at the end of the day is your work ethic.
He is a very good professor and if you pay attention he is not difficult to follow. Definitely study for his quizzes and the homework is very useful. MSI is great if you aren't fully getting it.
Great Teacher I love calculus now. Go to his office hours

Rude to students. He is very smart and makes a point to show it in his lectures. Rather than explaining his methods step by step to ensure a student's success, he only shows his own thought process which is so  abstracted that it seems as though he is deliberately making it difficult to understand. When asked to clarify, he says "it's right there."

His class doesn't prioritize on the arithmetic of statistics. Instead, he focuses on the propagation of its outcomes. If his class was about biology, he would focus mainly on  the extrinsic factors that cause animals to migrate rather than their natural adaptation in an environment.You'll learn a lot from his class but not precisely on the subject.

He is super unapproachable and sucks at explaining even the easiest subjects in calc. Goes way to fast and likes to make people feel dumb. I got an A in AMS lla with another teacher who actually cared about his students and now am averaging a D on my quizzes. Don't forget he writes in hieroglyphics on a projector that cannot fit the whole problem.

Really bad at explaining anything. He makes everything 10x harder than it should be. While taking notes he goes too fast, for you to follow. His handwriting is horrible. Never wants to answer questions. Yea, just don't take this guy, ever. You'll just be paying to use youtube to learn.

This guy is ridiculous. I pay 32k to be taught the studies I choose but instead get something else. This class isn't intended for all math majors so why the heck am I learning fundamental theorems? Just give me basics. Don't take if you want your 4.0 g.p.a

Makes the class 10x harder then it should be. Linear algebra should only be made this hard if you are a pure math major, but since most people are not that take ths course, teaching strictly through proofs is unneeded. Basically take 21 with another teacher since its very easy to compute everything, but going deep into theory is useless

Do NOT take this class with this professor. His lack of clarity and strange teaching methods will only make your grade suffer. Linear algebra is a difficult concept to grasp especially as a freshmen with little to no knowledge on this subject. While it is true that the class only involves basic arithmetic, the concepts require assistance. Run Away

Many students are so used to rote learning that when faced with theory and proof they freak out.  Yonatan is one of the best lecturers at UCSC, but he expects you to learn something in his class besides solving equations.  You want an easy A, go elsewhere.  Don't be intimidated by his no-nonesense style of teaching, he's actually a very sweet man.

Katznelson is a hard professor and his lectures will not make sense at one point. However, he is an excellent professor. I studied my ass off by going to office hours and MSI. My advice is to stay on track and keep up with his lectures(the moment you start slacking,it'll affect your scores). Do the problems in the book and just use MSI.
Lectures go right over your head. He makes no sense. All he does is go over the proofs rather than going over problems you will be having to solve on quizzes and tests. MSI WILL SAVE YOUR LIFE!

Katzy is a good, concise lecturer. I took AMS-5 and AMS-11B with him and while at first I didn't enjoy his lectures either, I have grown to like him. There is no online hw, which saves a lot of money, just quizzes, which are in class so you aren't required to go to section. Lots of practice finals. Do them and you will find success. Haterz gonna h8
This guy does not know what he is doing and thinks the class is a big joke.
All I have to say is CANT teach!
Homework is very inconsistent with test and lectures. He likes skipping steps while showing examples. Waste class time by asking Questions instead of show us what to do and get to the point.

This guy is definitely not worth your college funds. He spends more time joking and asking you to solve stuff instead of teaching you. He would stall for answers instead of ask questions in review sections. AVOID
This guy makes so much mistakes its laughable. He cant teach and gives you a "hard time" If you go to office hours. If you don't want to fail don't take him.
IF you are new and want to actually learn DONT take this class with him. Spends too much time on nonsense and will not help you if you ask.
The class basically was boring. I slept all the time. His jokes were corny and he didnt explain anything.
Can/'t teach, He is a real joker and loves to waste class time. I am thinking of dropping the class cuz... wasting my $
dude he doesnt know the stuf wellz

How to succeed in this god awful class. Do not rely on Yonatan you will surely fail as he does not put lectures on line or any other sources. Read the book and ask friends for help. Or just wait next quarter because he is god awfully disorganized.
Very smug in person, acts as a joker. Wasted class time lots on  joking. shoop da woop
Such an arse, after doing lots of asking i found out ever teacher out there is better than him
all my teachers this quarter are much better than him. dont know why he's of such lower quality than them all

Took this class for GE and thought it was easy but. He is freakin disorganized! I passed with a C just because the MSI (Thank God). He also is has a bad attitude towards students and made me feel very behind.
Oh god... he's liek prolly the bottom 2% of teachers i had qualitywise
AVOID if you dunno econ! Don't approach him for help he is very smug.
He's often monotoneous to me. I get sleepy in his class. He doesn't rely teach well either, I don't learn from him. I learn from other people.
he is a horrible teacher. you won't learn a single thing in his class. all he does is waste time making fun of ppl and lecture on things that aren't going to be on the test
This guy is a joker, he gets off topic often with jokes which he can use for questions. He also very uptight and rude so don't ask any questions. Rely on TA and MSI sections if possible.

Yonatan is also not helpful during office hours because he acts like you should know the stuff instead of finding ways to solve problems you have with the material. Avoid if you want to learn the material clearly.

Thanks for not making me feel like a kindergardener with mandatory attendance Mr. Katznelson. Bad reviews about this professor are BS he is a professional guy a good grader class is their filter for econ major so you better dedicate yourself lots of study and practice. Take if you want to feel like you're in college, wells as much as UCSC can
This teacher made fun of me in class. He also made me hate the subject. Thats my two cents

Professor Katz was not helpful after class. He doesnt seem to want to be in there and get out as fast as possible. Luckly I got some help from friends. Was really bored in class. But I passed and the topic was not hard Katz just made it more difficult than it seems
Professor was boring. Things were mediocre unless you had an dumb TA for section. Read the book to pass. Also the professor thinks he is funny but NO
he remind me of my old english teacher in high school.  probably one of the better teachers out there despite all the hate. he doesn't want to be in there anymore then you do, he just gets paid
Tough class, forces you to learn the concepts from the book.
This class was boring

Hands down the best teacher I have had at this UCSC.  As long as you do the homework you are in the clear for an A.  The reviews help too.  Yes he can be intimidating and dry...but it is all just part of the Katznelson experience.  He is super helpful during office hours as well, provided you have a question and have already tried solving it.

OMG! I totaly got slimed by the Katznelson!!  Funny guy.. HARD class if you aren't the math type... If you have to take it from someone do it from him... at least it will be entertaining.  GO TO SECTION it made a world of difference.

These people don't know what they're talking about (LAZY!) Katz is awesome.  He's dry, witty, and teaches the class ASSUMING YOU'VE STUDIED!  If you don't want to study then you should go to Heald.    Go to MSI, read the book, and do the reviews and you will be fine.  He applies the math to real world scenarios and has a VERY fair grading policy.

Sometimes I would sit in his class and wonder why I was there...I couldn't understand what he was talking about.  He posts reviews on his site, which was my saving grace...if you study the review sheets over and over again and you can do all the problems cold, you'll get an A.

Professor Katznelson may seem intimating, but he is absolutely a wonderful Professor. He knows his concepts super well and is able to teach it to the class. He's actually pretty easy as long as you do the work and do the right amount of studying. I got an A in this class and he is not as hard as everyone says on ratemyprofessors.com
Boring and not funny. READ THE BOOK AND YOU WILL PASS. TEACHER IS USELESS
omg lectures with him r jus so boring i cant stand them and my other classes r boring but not nearly as bad

Professor Katznelson is cant teach math Goddam! He is poor at teaching and is extremely unhelpful. He always seems intimidating. If you do fall behind use resources such as section and MSI.  His office hours are not helpful because he always wants to get out home on time rather than help you. But don't be afraid of him, because  the material is fre
Class is easy but the teacher cant teach. Concepts are all very easy but Katz confused the class. People also asked dumb questions but he delay answering
He is not helpful at all. This guy cant teach use the book and its alright. He seems nice at first but when approached he is really uptight on time

Professor Katznelson is a math God! He is a brilliant teacher and is extremely honest and helpful. He does come off as intimidating in the beginning, but only in order to make you take this class seriously. If you do fall behind there are many resources (section, MSI, his office hours). Don't be afraid of him, because he really is a nice guy.

Katznelson was a pretty good teacher. The class is easy as long as your keep up with the homework, read the sections before you go to class, go to discussions and MSI. Midterms are graded for students' favor. He drops your 3 lowest homework scores and your lowest midterm score. He's really nice and approachable if you go to his office hours!

Professor Katznelson is a wonderful math genius. He is intimidating on purpose, but if you can get over that, you will love his style. Classes are not mandatory, but you ,miss a lot by not going. He posts a tremendous amount of notes and reviews online, all of which are necessary. If you don't do well, it is your OWN fault. Great Professor!

I got to say: its a love/hate relationship.  He obisously knows what he's talking about, and you need to do the work to understand it, too.  He does seem like an **** at times, but he means well; he cares for his students. Just go to MSI/TAs/classmates for help.  The only reason ppl really hate him is cuz they never do the work or pay attention.

seriously..what the hell is he teaching?? I never understood any of his lectures because it was not useful to homework AT ALL. BUT! if u are required to take this class jsut go to MSI. VERY VERY HELPFUL! His tests are basically the same as homeworks.
for anyone that doesn't think math seriously rocks, this guy will make your life a living hell. He thinks everyone is at his level and will not let ya catch up
hard/useless/incomprehensible/no interest/lotta textbook usage

Not very useful in lecture,I rarely used notes taken in class.Id suggest going to all sections available to find best TA, goto MSI for help with hw and be on top of your game studying for exams.no grading curve at all,he has 3 exams instead of 2, he fails 50-60% of students each quarter- extremely elitist dont expect any help when asked. avoid !!!
Katz...Nice Guy if You Get To Know Him. He's Funny, Sarcastic.  Class is a lot of work, But You Learn a Lot. You have to be on top of your game in this class. laziness will fail you.

Avoid Katz if you can.  The only way to survive the class is by attending section and learning material from TA.  Katz spends all lectures proving theories, that do not help you at all in doing HW or exams.  DO NOT TAKE!

I'd seriously avoid him if possible, but if you have to take him the class is doable. I SUCK at math and his lectures don't help at ALL and aren't worth attending, but if you read the book and go to MSI you can pass. Never went to section either cuz the TA was just as bad.
I failed his class twice, lecture is useless, test are long and hard. Go to MSI/Section otherwise you will fail, approximately 35% he gives a D or an F each quarter (check ****)  I wouldn't take

Thinks he's hot stuff. His lectures consist of working problems on the board instead of actually showing you how to do them. He expects you to know the material before his lecture. Homeworks on material not previously covered in class, so basically you teach yourself from the book to be able to do the homework. Not very approachable.

I don't know what you guys are talking about. Katznelson is really approachable and is really nice. The material itself is hard, but he makes it a little easier. He's so smart, yea he can be kinda mean to students that ask questions, but if you go to his office hours, he's actually really nice.
dudes all business. takes math really seriously so be prepared and go to section/msi to learn
Jokes are lame and can't teach rely on TA or  AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!  nuff said
Cant Teach Recommend you use book or AVOID
liek its calculus! how hard is it to teach that? He's doing liek a bad job tho

He speaks articulately and avoids the monotone most math professors have, but I really didn't learn anything from his lectures. He moves very fast and is hard to follow. (protip: go to MSI) However, I really like his grading system. It allowed me to still pull off an A- despite scoring below average on every midterm.

He has a funny sense of humor as long as you know how to bring it out in him. His grading system is extremely fair and his tests are relatively easy. As long as you do the homework you should get a good grade. His lectures focus more on the broad scheme of things and do not seem very helpful on the homework, but the book is good and go to section.

You guys are dumb.  I thinkhe's an excellent professor, he just doesn't waste time with people who don't read the book and who don't care about Mathematics.  The problem is that most people don't do either.  READ the chapters BEFORE lecture, go to section, go to MSI, and you will get an A.  I did.  Stop whining.  Katznelson is the shiznit.And funny
he's had to understand. Compared to the book he's so unclear too
He makes the subject harder than its supposed to be. I often find the book easier than him, but anything i dont understand he wouldn't be a good to go asking

Katznelson needs to get organized. When I asked him a simple question he told me to come to office hours. I learned most material reading the book so I would say avoid him and the book is your best friend if you can intemperate it.

This guy makes so much mistakes while teaching I don't think he knows his material. He also makes jokes which the class laughs at for some reason even though it is not funny. I would suggest avoid if possible because you likely are better off with one of the other teachers.

Definitely had a greater sense of accomplishment in his Math 21 class than I had in both AMS 11A/B. Can only say great words about Katznelson. (He is truly intelligent and very fair.) Although I was pulling my hair out for most of last quarter, I will miss his classes very much and hope to take more in the future.

Yonatan is a great professor. He grades fairly. The class is not easy but you will actually learn something by the end. He made me actually want to understand the material, rather than just memorize a list of steps that specify how to do a problem. I got a C, but I am still glad I took his class!
For linear algebra, this guy just doesn't cut it. My advice: avoid getting him

this guy is pathetic. his TA's are ridiculous. they mess up on explaining how to derive the quadratic formula. are you kidding me? Whoever grades the homework (probably katznelson) gives at most a 11/15 on completed homework. for 3 or 4 problems incorrect out of total 20+ math problems, you get a 6/15. Ridiculous grading system. useless lectures

Katznelson is an amazing professor for linear algebra. He made the abstract concepts very interesting and ignited quite an interest for mathematics in me. In general linear algebra is a difficult course to teach well, but he does an outstanding job. Tests are fairly straight forward (about 75% application and 25% theory). Do the review questions!
An awful teacher who blames his students for not doing well on impossible scenarios that he calls a test.
He makes math harder than it's suppose to be.
Very bad teacher. Blames everything on the students when its obviously his bad teaching abilities at fault.

I gave him a 2 on helpfulness just cuz i was able to ASK. But he did not answer and cut off my questions. I could always find his math examples right from his book. Thats the only thing that made him even a bit helpful. Overall bad D=
No Comments
He grades unfair compared to other math classes and he is really bad at explaining things.
No Comments
If you took econ you'll know what I mean when I say kyou get the LEAST marginal utility taking this class :P
Didn't do well in his class and I learned nothing! Bad teacher! Even though I did the work.
Avoid this teacher! He gets off topic from time to time and waste time on jokes! Plus he makes errors while trying to teach from the book! Can't teach  or have his own examples
Oh man for a math teacher this guy really sucks at addition AND subtraction. He can't do either well and should REALLY not be teaching linear algebra.
LOVE YA KATZNELSON YOU ARE THE BEST! YOU HAVE SUCH FUNNY JOKES WE ALL BURST OUT LAUGHING!!! YOUR STUFF IS SO UNDERSTANDABLE AND EASY! 2 THUMBS UP!
I got soo screwed over in this class. $2000 DOWN THE DRAIN and also $120 ON THE USELESS TEXTBOOKS

Katznelson... what can i say, he's a stingy****who teaches calculus. His tests aren't easy and there's a lot of note taking, but he obviously knows the material and explains it adequately. He picks really awful TAs who mostly can't speak english.

Great math teacher, he doesnt waste time on stuff, cuts out all the ****.  If you actually want to learn, take his class.  He's funny and keeps the class unboring (except his proofs which you can ignore).  Tests are easy if you learn the material, he's very fair and knows his stuff.

One of the best math teachers I have had in my whole life. His combination of funny sarcasm and extreme understanding of the subject provides for an awesome learning environment. Goes a little quick in lecture, homework is not overwhelming, and good test reviews.

moves fast wehn writing on the board; typical math teacher- explains theoums before presentin example problems; his exams are hard so understand the hard problems in the book; he tests your understanding of concepts more than you algebra; thorough thinking; concise explainer

His style is great. He can be really sarcastic at times, but he's got a good humor and a witty style. If you stick the review sheet online then you will perform very well on his exams. In his class it's all about staying on top of things. If you do so, you're gaurenteed a good grade.
Great math teacher. will truly push you. has a good sense of humor. DO YOUR HW tho

He is one of the greatest professors. He is very nice and understanding. There is no question that he knows the materials. And the best part, he really make the best out of the class. I totally recommend katznelson to all students!

Arrogant at first, but quite humorous in his own subtle way, especially for an 8am class. Clarity is weak because of the speed at which he explains and he fails to keep up his hard nosed, no-nonsense stature towards the end of the semester.
did a horrible job in explaining econometrics
Extemely boring lectures(he does proofs) but helpfull in office hours. He comes off as sort of a tough teacher but he's really not at all. His class is not easy but it's exactly hard either.

He was a great teacher, the best math teacher i've ever had.  The class was by no means easy, but if you put in effort he made things crystal clear.  He had a very cool attitude, at the beginning of the quarter he is intimidating, but he lightens up later
No Comments
He's strick but he's funny. His review questions are the same as his tests. If you understand his lecture notes, it would help you a lot. Econ 11A is easy but econ B is a lot harder and tougher.
I don't like his class

Katzenelson was by far the best math teacher I have ever had. He is a natural public speaker- clever, good sense of humor, etc. He also really understood the math inside and out, and understood what made it interesting. Straightforward tests.

Yonatan was an awesome calulus teacher. His lectures were very difficult to follow but it all made since after sections and homework. He demands work and effort, but it all pays off. His exams and fair and his review sheets make all the difference.

Very cool. Hard, just keep up the work and you'll do fine. Study review sheets and old tests! He's got a mean glare when he gives back tests, but it's nothing, he's a sweetie underneath and very helpful if you ask questions, or need help
he sure loves math. study hard for this class. not a bad lecturer though. makes some funny jokes. but if you dont understand something, ASK!!! all i have to say is, damn look at his eyebrows.
Good lecturer. I dont think those eyebrows are intrinsic, i think he gels them. Study very hard. Sorta cynical but all in good fun. he sure loves his math though.
tough but fair.
His homework is easy. The material is medium. But his test are long and there is not enough time and different from the homework.  Not recommended for math but recommended for Econ!
No Comments

Such a great teacher, I absolutely love his calculus classes. Do all the homework and know the textbook front and back and go to class and you'll be fine. I got an A in 11A and B in 11B. Super easy. He's a very intelligent and funny professor! Yaaaaay katznelson!!

Probably the smartest professor I've had at the university -- if you attend, take good notes, and keep up with the material, it's possible to get a good grade. No notes are online because he writes all of them from memory onto the chalkboard. One of the most worthwhile classes I've ever had. You WILL know calculus after this course.

Can be cool but he has a tendency to make you feel stupid if you dont follow fast enough. Reviews and homework are extremely helpful for the tests, but he likes to throw curve balls in too, so know your natural logs and e stuff.  The book is more helpful than lecture, but he gives a lot of hints for tests and hw so go as often as you can.

He is a very hard teacher.  You must not skip his class once.  Attend every class, skip one lecture is like a week's worth.  He can be an assh*le but he knows what's he's talking about.  GO TO MSI like me and score! -141.1 LiFE

I think Katznelson is great, he covers materials very good, but sometimes alittle fast. He got 3 mid-terms, 4 questions each, total is 25 points with 3 extra credits. I think is very easy pass...so far i am A-ing the class. Also, great T.A. too.

Mr. Katznelson is a great teacher. He is also incredibly smart. He seems intimidating in lecture, but when you talk to him one on one, he is very nice. I took 11a and got a C then started to take 11b and got an F on the first midterm and dropped. Now im retaking the class and I have an A+ right now. It's really easy if you do the homework yourself.

It's not hard to do well in Katznelson's class. Even though he moves really fast and sometimes it's hard to follow what he's talking about in lecture, going to section & doing the review sheets is extremely helpful. Overall he's a great professor who really knows his stuff.

AMAZING TEACHER!! KNOWS WHAT HE'S TALKING ABOUT AND IS ALWAYS WILLING TO HELP. OFFICE HOURS ARE GREAT. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THAT YOU DO ALL YOUR HOMEWORK IN THIS CLASS AND GO TO MSI AND YOU'LL GET AN A+.
the definition of a killer teacher, your better off taking it P/NP or taking a different route to satisfy the requirement.  Never procrasinate with this class or you will fall wayyyy behind.
Very knowledgeable.  On top of his game when he lectures.  His office hours are not very helpful if you don't understand something...he woudln't let me finish any of my questions!
This class is very difficult.  That said, it is possible to get an A while also takig other hard classes but you have to say peace out to literally 90% of your social life for the whole quarter...

After first midterm youll start to appreciate his lectures--he'll start to use examples that actually help with homework. Class goes from easy to hard fast so be prepared to go to MSI and if you can go to Mariam's sections; for midterms/finals STUDY REVIEWSHEETS. I did very well in this class but spent about 10 hrs/wk studying--20 extra for final

This guy came out of nowhere from the Econ dept but really showed the Math kids how sh*t goes down. Seemingly intimidating, but a really great man and professor. I'm glad I had him for this course(very proof intensive). Knows way more than he lets on. Very knowledgeable in other subjects too. Keep on truckin, Yonathan!

you have to know material very well in order to pass his class. exams are tough since there is no curve and there are only a few problems. he knows his material, he is clearly very intelligent, but he makes things seem more complicated than they really are.
He knows his stuff! Can seem intimidating but is super helpful. Do the hw and you should be fine. I learned alot in his class!! Great teacher!!

Simply put: attend lecture, do your review sheets, do you hw and get a good grade. Katznelson knows his stuff really well,may seem intimidating but really helpful in office hours. Basically be on top of the work and you'll do fine. If you don't then u'll be like the ppl below.
No Comments
He's a G, he walks in right on time, no notes, no notebook, nothing, just a cup of coffee. He picks up the chalk and goes to work for the next hour and ten minutes, I have never seen him mess up.
Jeez he's just too smart, so he overlooks certain things....and then i get confused as all hell. he doesn't make things simple, but he knows what hes doing, and he knows it well!
No Comments

These are hard classes.  Prof. Katznelson really knows his stuff and he'll definitely work with you.  I am very relieved to be done with this series, but I'm glad that he was the professor because it could have been MUCH worse.  If you're having trouble, talk to him...he'll listen and help where he can.  Just don't expect an easy A.
He is a very good teacher.  You have to put in a lot of effort, but at the end you will learn a lot. Very fair on the grade system.

He is a true math genius.  He knows the material and wants to teach it.  He is intimidating making it hard to ask questions in class.  It was still a pleasant experience to have him as an instructor.  You have to put in the work and effort for his class but you learn quite a bit in the end.

Really spent time on explaining the materials although sometime the lectures are somewhat hard to follow. Tests are quite fair. I would say this is a fair class, not a easy class. If you go to MSI and sessions and study, getting a B shouldn't be that difficult.
I hate math in general, but calculus was fairly interesting.  It's been a while since I took his classes, but I ended up with B's.  You have to make a lot of effort but it's fair in the end.

Evil pure evil.  very hard to approach and rude if you do not grasp parts of the material.  If you have a good MSI assistant the class is quite passable.  If not your screwed.  lecture is almost worthless.

I loved Dr. Katznelson!!!!! I thought his lectures showed a lot of thought, and he strived to present the material in a clear and concise manner. Maybe the people who think he is condescending should think before asking a (stoopid) question!!

the class is kinda hard. I got an A in 11b, because i learned from his tests in 11a. If you go to MSI and review the practice exams a few times, you will be fine. He puts the same type of problems on the midterms as he does on the practice ones.
A little arogant and condescending. He didn't seem to care about the students progress and was unapproachable. If you need to take Pre-calc. take Math3.

He is such an assh*le...NO CURVE WHAT-SO-EVER! Be prepared, you have to be able to fail the final, so unless you have all A's before, drop the class and save yourslef frma having to take it over. This happens to alot of people!
repeats too many times of a concept. very confusing
Very inintering lecturer. Very uncaring towards students. Not sympathetic to those who had a hard time. Very condescending to anyone who asked any typeof question. Avoid if at all possible.

Failed his class once. Understood his material better 2nd time. Tests were not easy & if you slack off, it would be extremely hard for you.  Most ppl who do pass have to put in a lot of time into the studying & most passes with a C.  He's gotten harder on section attendance recently.
No Comments

Katznelson, definitely has an enlarged ego and a chip on his shoulder. I found that his lectures were confusing and never helpful to actually learning the material. Be prepared to take extra time out of class to understand the material (eg MSI, section) I recommend Math 11A rather than this class.

He definitely knows the material, and makes class interesting with his sarcastic humor. He doesn't take stupid questions and doesn't waste time. Lectures cover a lot of material, and tests are tough, but fair. Do the homework and study the material and youll be fine.

Professor has some serious ego problems.  He embarasses students when they try to answer his open ended questions.  Very arrogant and intimidating.  Exams are unpredictable.  Not helpful during office hours.  Lectures are tediously drawn out.  On average half the class fails each quarter.

He does know his stuff. As far as lecturing goes he is awful. Moves way to quickly, goes on for hours on proofs that make no sense, and don't try to ask questions unless you want him to make you look stupid. Not enough time to complete tests. Sections worthless, TA doesn't speak english.

geez! this is what I see when my friend tells me to check my grades!!! I spent the most time studying for this class too! All my other classes were A's and I have no idea what happened here! It has to be him and not me!!!!
He is no help during office hours and would not answer questions directly. He made errors in his lecture!
He was more hyper than me on 3 caffeine pills. To top that off, he didnt let me finish asking any of my questions. I swear i smelled pot off of him too....
He can kind of lecture. Does not answer questions directly. He needs to write clearly!!!!!!!!! Test is not based on reviews. No active reviews for test! AVOID
No Comments
Man what a lousy piece of crap!(not him, the book) but he still cant teach good he talks too fast, and wont answer questions. He got mad at us i think he has lots of personal problems
He makes simple concepts confusing and he makes errors while teaching in lectures. Avoid!
He is high on coffee and you can/'t understand him. But when you go to his office hours he expects you to know what he said.

I really enjoyed his class.  He is a good teacher and I love his eyebrows!  Lol But his class can be hard.  If you do the review notes for the tests and understand them, you'll do fine.  He basically rewrites the tests w/ the review notes.  In class he can be a little confusing but read the book and you'll be fine. He is pretty accomodating too.

Good at lecturing but is very inconsiderate of other people who are failing.  Don't tell him to repeat a concept he will make you feel like you just got OWNED! The book is alrigt but I heard the other teacher was easier. The grading scale is not tipped in favor of students

Very interesting lectures. Uncaring towards students and will make you feel like you are a idiot if you ask for help. Inconsiderate to those who had a hard time in the class also.  Avoid if at all possible or know your stuff before you enter then you will be fine.  Think he is only teaching for the money

Smart guy I have to say. He knows a lot about the subjects he teaches.... now that just leaves one problem: I wish he knew how to teach as well as he knew everything else. If you know the material before going into the class then it shouldn't be a problem. At times(commonly) he can be unclear, especially on the board. He randomly jokes in class, bu

Oh my god. I sat in class EVERYDAY. It was such a waste of time too! The book also soaked lots of that time up and it took long to understand things. Calculus without a teacher is even easier that having to deal with the book we were given. Oh and those sections weren't so useful as I thought. There is only one TA, and no, not as helpful, but more

well, the material wasn't too bad. Maybe it was because I'm a math major. Few in the class are math majors. As for those who aren't i really feel sorry for them as this teacher isn't good at explaining anything. I'd have to explain the material the poor souls in my own words, which were a lot easier to understand than the teacher's. The book also h
Tests are easy if you go to lectures. His lectures were very clear and TAs are helpful.

Do not take the class with Katznelson he seriously will not provide you with the material you need to learn for the class.  His notes are unclear and he makes about mistakes while lecturing. His notes do not match up with test material and is inconsistant with how he gets his answers. Take this class with professor Tantalo its much easier

If you did't take any math dont take this class.  The requirements said no calculus but it has some calculus.  Also unlike the other math classes this he has NO test review and No help. Katznelson always makes minor mistakes in class too and will not do most problems out fully but trust the majority of the classes answer. If you are not a math majo
Test review inconsistant with homework. No available help provided for midterms.  Spends too much time on proofs in class and not how to do the work

Took his Econ/AMS 11 series, got A+ in both.  I enjoyed his class very much but some parts were not easy.  Now taking his math 21 and it's a 180 degree turn.  Material is very different, hard to grasp (in my opinion) and more conceptual.  Struggling through it a lot (which is a first for me in math) but overall one of my favorite professors.
Really mean guy.

You should NOT slack off in his classes, but you will find it very rewarding if you put in the proper effort.  Show up for all classes, study well, and you'll be fine.  Tough but fair, a true college professor.
Smart and mean
Yoni is a hard fair teacher.  Do all the HW and ask for help if you do not understand.  Be sure to check out his devilish pointy eyebrows and try to get him to talk about playing basketball.
i did not like this professor
The subjects he teaches are really hard. I guess that's why I ended up have C's in BOTH of his classes.... =( If you take this class, GET TUTORING!!

My favorite teacher @ UCSC.  He's strict, but-only to weed out the flakes.  He was always available for questions, easy to approach during class, after class and test.  The key is to do the work required for the class and gain his respect.

had to drop this class, pretty hard, but the teacher knows his stuff and seems fair, i'll try again next quarter
Tough but fair professor, teaches material thoroughly.

He's a great professor, you just have to try, like he says the first day of class. He can be a **** but that is only when stupid questions are asked or people clearly slacked off. He may be weeding people out, but if you try hard, theres nothing to worry about. Ask questions that aren't in the realm of precalculus, he's more than happy to help.

this guy is just simply horrible, its hard to fathom that this guy is teaching a class and not in a padded room...take the calc 11a series instead this fool was given directions to weed out people and he gladly does so

Basically, lecture r slow which when comes to do hw, you will have lots of problem, so go to MSI to get help with hw problems.  For midterms, memorize the formulas n specially ask tutor for the last year midterm and study both last year n current, then you'll be in good shape!

He makes things more difficult than they need to be and is the worst teacher I have ever had. He is very moody and moves way too fast. He is not willing to help when you ask for help. I would attend MSI sessions, but I commute from an hour and a half away, so it is hard to meet the times they were offered.

Bad professor.  His lectures were unclear and confusing.  So I went to his office hours for extra help, and he told me to do extra practice problems (even though I couldn't do them it the first place!).  Extremely unhelpful and would make students feel stupid when they had questions in lecture.  However, his tests were fair.

The professor is moody and arrogant. He makes you feel uncomfortable to ask questions. He has, however, a strong command of the subject and presents it clearly. It is reasonable to earn an "A" in the class as long as you do the homework, do the review exams, attend sections and MSI, and consult with him during office hours.

His class is difficult reguardless of the material.  He doesn't just want you to learn the material and then use it verbatim, you are required to apply it which means you need to be adaptable while taking the test.  He threw a curveball question on the final that was on material covered 4 days before the final.  I would wait for someone else.

wants students to do well but lacks the ability to communicate effectively with his students for some reason, i think a grad school class at a good uni. would help him tremendously, overall a good duy though and VERY FUNNY
He is a very good teacher.  He really knows his stuff and definitely wants his students to do well.  The material is hard, but he does an impressive job explaining it.  I've dreamt about him.

I didnt pass his class the first time because I was lazy and didnt take it serious. BUt the 2nd time around, I study off the midterms and hws and listen in class and got B+. Hes intimidating but a very good teacher, hes probably one of few teachers that cares about your education. You will learn something in his class.

Also MY favorite prof.  I would always get 2/10 on homeworks because I didn't fully understand the material by the due date but by the time the midterms and final came up he made it all very clear.  Ended up failing all homeworks and getting A's on the tests giving me a grade of B.  He's very smart and if you're respectful to him he'll be respectful to you.

Dr Katznelson is one of the best professors I've ever had!!!! He shocked me by calling me by name during a 113 midterm! His class websites are always helpful and his view on homework actually made me realize that homework is actually kinda important.

Econ 11a I went to class and just rode through it like a typical boring class. I hated it. Econ 11b I came with it.. If you actually work in this class you'll do fine. If you just go and don't really engage yourself you'll hate it. He WILL work with you if you go to his office. He's EXTREMELY intimidating but VERY smart. work hard and get past what YOU view his personality to be, youll learn and get a decent grade. STUDY OFF HIS REVIEW SHEETS
he's hard, but hes an amazing teacher. He teachers the material well and is always willing to help. Also he seems scary but really hes not.

he teaches tough subjects and does so quickly.  i spent more time studying for these classes than any other.  if you have him, take advantage of msi and keep up with the homework.  you can not fall behind or you will fail.  he even wrote a reference letter for eap for me, even though i rarely talked to him.
Mean, dont bother attempting to solve problems in class he just makes you look like an idiot for trying, and even if you are right he'll tell you that it isnt 100% correct
